Articles.Content: also, if you look at the very end of the video where he launches a bigger rocket, it appears to me that the smoke actually scales with the amount of engine exhaust produced so it's not just a simple static effect, even better!
Can't wait for some sick new smokescreen configs to go with the new 1.0 effects!
Does anybody know if this is working in 1.0?

Does anybody know if this is working in 1.0?

yes works fine has there are no parts and smokescreen has updated but you will need to get smokescreen from it's thread.
actually I just tested it and, at least for jet engines, their afterburners are always on full, even when the engines haven't been activated yet. anyone else having this problem, or just me?
Think if you look back a page you will see not just you

Quick question. For something that might look better when spread out in vacuum, and to lessen the 'slow particles' that are in use. Would it be possible to use something more similar to the reentry flames?

I found a bug with KSP 1.0.

The effects are visible on Jet Engines (excluding rapier) even when they are off.

Anyone can confirm this ?

I found a bug with KSP 1.0.

The effects are visible on Jet Engines (excluding rapier) even when they are off.

Anyone can confirm this ?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65754-HotRockets%21-Particle-FX-Replacement-Tutorial?p=1881054&viewfull=1#post1881054

I seem to have found another bug, using the latest Smokescreen and this in 1.0; When an engine runs out of fuel, the flame and sound effects keep playing. Thrust stops, of course, but it looks and sounds like it's still on. Any idea how to fix this?

I seem to have found another bug, using the latest Smokescreen and this in 1.0; When an engine runs out of fuel, the flame and sound effects keep playing. Thrust stops, of course, but it looks and sounds like it's still on. Any idea how to fix this?

Same issue, here. I haven't heard anything about a fix being worked on. I wonder if the problem is widespread in 1.0.
